name: 蘇昭瑾
objective: The purpose of this course is to elucidate the gas-solid interfacial phenomena, principles and techniques of surface science and its application to meet the increasing demand for analysis of solid surfaces in both the “academic” and “technological” fields.
schedule:
Week 1   　　Open Course
Week 2　　Introduction to Surface Science and Technology
Week 3   　　From Single Crystal to Single Crystal Surfaces
Week 4   　　Surface Relaxation and Reconstruction
Week 5   　　Adsorption and Bonding
Week 6   　　Kinetics of Surface Adsorption
Week 7   　　Get Ready for Surface Analysis 
Week 8   　　Electron Materials Interactions
Week 9   　　Mid Term Examination
Week 10   X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS, ESCA)-1
Week 11　　X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS, ESCA)-2
Week 12  　　Topic 11  Auger Electron Spectroscopy (AES)
Week 13　　Low Energy Electron Diffraction (LEED)
Week 14　　Scanning Tunneling Microscopy (STM)
Week 15　　Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM)
Week 16　　Temperature Programmed Desorption (TPD)
Week 17　　Final Examination
Week 18　　Make up class/Surface Vibrational Spectroscopy 　　　　(FT-IR, HREELS)
scorePolicy:
Mid Term Examination: 40%　　　　Final Examination: 40%
Absent and Tardy: 20%

For on-line class, the class performance evaluation will be based on on-line tests or reports.
materials:
1.Principles of Adsorption and Reaction on Solid Surfaces, Richard I. Masel, Wiley Series in Chemical Engineering, handout
2.Surfaces, Gary Attard and Cobin Barnes, Oxford Chemistry Primers Vol.59, Oxford Science Publications. handout
